maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Monday September 27, 2021 at 18:02

did.abstract: Samuel Wolcott was born to Elihu and Rachel McClintock Wolcott in South Windsor, Connecticut, on July 2, 1813. He graduated from Yale College in 1833 and Andover Theological Seminart in 1837. He would go on to be an assisstant secretary for the A.B.C.F.M. Samuel would be ordained on November 1st, 1839. Some places where we worked as a minister includes Longmeadow, Belchertown, Providence, Chicago, and Cleveland. He died in Longmeadow, Massachusetts on February 24, 1886. This collection is a single journal that gives an account of Samuel Wolcott's daily activities.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to some of the physical items is restricted. When microfilm surrogates exist, they are to be used instead of originals. Exceptions may be granted in cases of extenuating circumstance, at the discretion of the Archivist.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Samuel Wolcott journal, 1869-1885, MS5428. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Collection was donated to the Congregational Library and Archives by Brigham Young University by 2021, accession number 2021-13.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by William McCarthy in September 2021, using DACS Second Edition.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Samuel Wolcott was born to Elihu and Rachel McClintock Wolcott in South Windsor, Connecticut, on July 2, 1813. He graduated from Yale College in 1833 and Andover Theological Seminart in 1837. He would go on to be an assisstant secretary for the A.B.C.F.M. Samuel would be ordained on November 1st, 1839. Some places where we worked as a minister includes Longmeadow, Belchertown, Providence, Chicago, and Cleveland. He died in Longmeadow, Massachusetts on February 24, 1886.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection is a single journal that gives an account of Samuel Wolcott's daily activities.
